INTRO.subTitle: The best hosting for your podcast
INTRO.title: Host your Podcast with NestCast
text: Nestcast helps you quickly and easily distribute your podcast to Spotify, Apple Podcasts, Podimo, and all other smaller podcast platforms. We ensure that your podcast becomes available using an RSS feed, the format for making podcasts available to podcast platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts.
Nestcast can provide the best podcast service at a competitive price. We can do this by using AI and machine learning. Our revolutionary platform is maintained by a small team, keeping our costs low.

SNIPPET_RIGHT.title: Podcast hosting & RSS
text: To host a podcast, it is necessary to make your audio files available on a server and generate an RSS feed that indicates which episodes are available. This RSS feed is used by podcast platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts to make your podcast available to listeners.
There are many companies that focus on podcast hosting, but NestCast is the only one that focuses solely on hosting and distributing podcasts. This is why we are the best at what we do.

We use the latest techniques and services to achieve the highest level of service at a low cost. We work with Angular 16, NestJs, and MongoDB. This ensures that we can provide a fast and reliable service. Our developers are constantly working on innovation and improving our service to ensure you always have a state-of-the-art product.

SNIPPET_LEFT.title: Podcast platforms
text: Spotify, Amazon Music, Samsung Podcasts, Podcast Index, Listen Notes, Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, Pandora, Tune In, iHeartRadio, Deezer. These are just some of the platforms on which we can make your podcast available. We ensure that your podcast is available to as many listeners as possible.
The RSS feed we make available for your podcast is structured in a way that can be used by all platforms. You have optimal control over how your podcast is displayed on different platforms.

INTRO.subTitle: The technology behind NestCast
INTRO.title: About NestCast
text: NestCast was born out of a passion for podcasts and technology. Our founder, Joris Pieters, has been creating podcasts for years. He created the popular podcast "B&Gay vol Liefde," which follows the adventures of the contestants of the program "B&B Vol Liefde."

Combining podcast knowledge with a background as a Full Stack Developer made it possible to create a highly technological platform for podcast hosting. As AI and machine learning play an increasingly significant role in technology today, NestCast also uses these technologies. With them, we hope to innovate even faster.

TECHNIQUES.title: Techniques
text: We use the most modern techniques and services to provide the highest level of service possible. Users will mainly see the front end of our application for managing and distributing their podcasts. We have developed a Single Page Application (SPA) for this purpose, which results in an application that works without page refreshes during use.

stack.title: Tech stack
text: NestCast uses Angular to provide a modern user experience. Angular is a framework maintained by Google. TypeScript is used for programming within the framework. In our backend, we use Nest.js, a backend framework based on Node, and TypeScript is the programming language there as well. Nest is largely based on the module structure of Angular.

items.title: NgRx
items.text: State management for Angular based on Redux

items.title: NestJs
items.text: NodeJS backend framework based on the module structure of Angular

items.title: NodeJs
items.text: The framework that made server-side JavaScript possible

items.title: TypeScript
items.text: A layer on top of JavaScript to provide type safety

stack.title: Automated tests
text: To improve the quality of our software and keep costs low, automated tests are essential. We use various types of tests to ensure the quality of our software.

items.title: Jest
items.text: Jest is a JavaScript testing framework designed to ensure the correctness of every JavaScript codebase.

items.title: Spectator
items.text: A layer on the Angular test framework to simplify testing Angular components.

items.title: Cypress
items.text: An end-to-end testing framework for web applications built on Mocha, Chai, and Sinon.

stack.title: Services
text: To host our application and distribute your podcast, we use various cloud services. All of these services are cloud-based, meaning we don't have our own servers and rely on the servers of the service providers. This ensures that we don't have to maintain our servers and can always use the latest technologies.

items.title: AWS
items.text: Amazon Web Services is a cloud computing platform offered by Amazon.com

items.title: AWS S3
items.text: S3 is the storage service of AWS. We use S3 to store the audio files of your podcast.

items.title: MongoDB
items.text: A NoSQL database that we use to store the data of your podcast.

items.title: GitHub
items.text: This is an online service to manage and share our code with other developers.

items.title: GitHub Actions
items.text: Automated software deployment using GitHub Actions pipelines.

stack.title: AI
text: This text is generated by AI. We use AI to improve the quality of our software and keep costs low. We use various types of AI to ensure the quality of our software.

items.title: Codium
items.text: Codium analyzes code and automatically writes tests, and it also provides code suggestions.

items.title: Chat GPT
items.text: ChatGPT is a prototype of an AI-powered chatbot developed by OpenAI.

items.title: GitHub Copilot
items.text: GitHub Copilot converts natural language hints into coding suggestions in dozens of languages.

INTRO.subTitle: The highest price quality
INTRO.title: Subscriptions
text: Our subscriptions will have a low price for both business and private customers. We mainly focus on customers who consider it important to have their podcast available and accessible.

To keep your podcast available, it's crucial that the price isn't too high. When the number of listeners decreases, it may no longer be profitable to keep your podcast available. We ensure that your podcast remains available at a low price.

SNIPPET_RIGHT.title: Personal subscription
text: For hobbyists or novice podcasters, the personal subscription is a good choice. You can host all your episodes and make them available on all major platforms. You have access to an extensive management console to manage your podcast and view statistics.

Businesses often have a lot of content that may not be very current but is important to keep available. NestCast helps these businesses keep their content available without incurring unnecessary costs.

SNIPPET_LEFT.subTitle: The highest price quality
SNIPPET_LEFT.title: Business subscriptions
text: For our business customers, we offer a similar subscription to our private customers. The difference lies in the billing. With a business subscription, the invoice is issued in the name of the company.

To keep your podcast available, it's crucial that the price isn't too high. When the number of listeners decreases, it may no longer be profitable to keep your podcast available. We ensure that your podcast remains available at a low price.

PRICING.title: Subscriptions
text: Starting from early 2024, two subscriptions will be available with a comparable price. A business subscription and a private subscription. These subscriptions are available with a so-called fair use policy. If your podcast's usage exceeds a certain threshold, a surcharge will be applied. This surcharge depends on the number of listeners and the duration of the podcast.

INTRO.subTitle: Amsterdam is our home
INTRO.title: Contact NestCast
text: NestCast is an Amsterdam-based company, and we are proud of it. Amsterdam is filled with IT talent and has an excellent start-up environment. Amsterdam is also the podcast capital of the Netherlands. We are proud to have our company here. Our office is located in Amsterdam West, Bos en Lommer.

We'd like to get in touch with anyone interested in podcast hosting. We're always looking for new customers and new colleagues. Are you a developer and want to work on an innovative product? Get in touch with us.

ABOUT.title: About NestCast
text: NestCast aims to be the most technically advanced podcast hosting company. Through the use of AI and the latest technologies, we are able to provide the best service at the lowest price.
